questions.model_answer:
\textbf{Step 1: Break the surd into a square number and another factor} \hfill (1)

\qquad Rewrite $ 48 $ as $ \sqrt{a^2 \times b} $.

\qquad Find the square root of the square number and leave the other part as a surd.

\qquad Simplifies to: $ 16\sqrt{3} $

\vspace{0.3cm}
\textbf{Step 2: Write the final simplified answer} \hfill (1)

\qquad Final answer: $ 16\sqrt{3} $
\vspace{0.3cm}
questions.question_description: Express $ 48 $ in the form $k\sqrt{3}$ where $k$ is an integer.
